requirements: Prerequisites: MATH 120 and MB&B 300 or equivalents, or with permission of instructors.
description:
An introduction to quantitative methods relevant to analysis and interpretation of biophysical and biochemical data. Topics include statistical testing, data presentation, and error analysis; introduction to mathematical modeling of biological dynamics; analysis of large datasets; and Fourier analysis in signal/image processing and macromolecular structural studies. Instruction in basic programming skills and data analysis using MATLAB; study of real data from MB&B research groups.
Prerequisites: MATH 120 and MB&B 300 or equivalents, or with permission of instructors.
title: Quantitative Approaches in Bio...
long_title: Quantitative Approaches in Biophysics and Biochemistry
